ratings.comment: Great class, great professor.  I sincerely hope he doesn't retire because all of you will miss his incredible lectures.  Class is top notch but very difficult.  Be prepared to make flashcards...lots of flashcards.

Very interesting class, but it is not easy! I studied days in advance and learned as we went and had to retake the class still! Don't challenge him, he'll make you look stupid. Don't take this class if you already have a tough schedule, the amount you have to memorize is out of this world!

Bruce is, without a doubt, the best professor I have ever had.  This is also the hardest class I've ever taken.  LOVE the lack of detailed powerpoints; you actually have to pay attention during class.  Exams are hard but doable.  Bruce makes even the most dry topics in parasitology interesting.
Hardest class ever taken. Pure memorization. Study lecture notes everyday. No need for book. Announced quizzes - fairly easy. Exam is torture!

Professor is extremely interesting, funny, cheery, reasonable, helpful, and smart guy. He knows what he's talking about, and dont challenge him because he obviously knows his material 100x better than you will. Depend on lecture notes to do well in the class, study and be interested in the material!

Super interesting class and he is an interesting even a funny professor at times.  With that being said this class is NOT easy.  Along with organic chemistry this was one of the hardest classes I took simply because of the sheer amount of information we had to memorize.  I studied for days upon days and barely managed to get the averages on the exa

This was the most interesting class that I have taken so far, and it has changed what I have wanted to do with my future. However, just because it is interesting doesn't mean it's easy-- I studied for days before the exam and still did the average, which is in the 70s. Crucial to know every single detail and go to every lecture.

People haven't reviewed this class for awhile so I signed up under the impression it wouldn't be too hard. ...WRONG. This class can be interesting at times. But talking about a ton of parasites, with a ton of different names and remembering all the details is incredibly difficult. The exams are VERY hard & detailed as well.

Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had the pleasure of having. Exams can cover anything and everything said in lecture. So don't skip, but he doesn't waste time with useless info. That being said, the exams are fair, and if you keep up there shouldn't be a problem. Highly recommended, you won't regret it. Actually enjoyed going.

He's very enthusiastic and makes Parasitology interesting.  His exams are nitpicky so make sure you set aside a lot of time to memorize every little detail, like what parasites affect dogs, infective stages, life cycles, diagnostic tests, names.  No need to buy the book.  Don't skip lecture and be ready to take notes quickly since he talks fast.
really stimulating prof, you can tell he loves teaching this class. the exams aren't bad, straight from lecture material. the quizzes given in lecture are easy points

Best professor I've had so far!!   The man is full of knowledge and gets excited about all the icky parasites.  Go to lecture--he writes many important facts not found in the text.  Textbook is a good supplement, but not necessary.  Thanks to this man, I found my major!

Really interesting and cool lecturer, best I've had in the  sciences. You don't want to miss any because he uses the board, and draws great diagrams (love the snails, fish, racoons, etc.) which helps you learn as you frantically scribble down notes.
I LOVE this professor, I wish he taught more classes.

extremely enthusiastic prof.  Knows mountains of info about the subject.  The only time he is hard to understand is when he gets into a topic he really likes because he rushes with excitement through it.  He encourages students to ask him to slow down though bc he knows how he can rush.  I loved this class.
